abstract: We give an explicit graph formula, in terms of decorated boundary strata classes, for the wall-crossing of universal Brill-Noether classes. More precisely, fix $n>0$ and $d<g$ , and two stability conditions $Ï†^-, Ï†^+$ for degree~$d$ compactified universal (over $\overline{\mathcal{M}}_{g,n}$) Jacobians that lie on opposite sides of a stability hyperplane. Our main result is a formula for the difference between the Brill-Noether classes, compared via the pullback along the (rational) identity map $\mathsf{Id} \colon \overline{\mathcal{J}}^d_{g,n} (Ï†^+) \dashrightarrow \overline{\mathcal{J}}^d_{g,n} (Ï†^-)$. The calculation involves constructing a resolution of the identity map by means of subsequent blow-ups.
